result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Gilbert Del Portillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and DNA surcharge to be paid within 90 days. FTP 10 days RCJ

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander Gilbert Del Portillo

Defendant Alexander Gilbert Del Portillo in court with attorney Jeffrey J Morgan.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Alexander Gilbert Del Portillo in court with attorney Jeffrey J Morgan.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.
